Opor ayam is an Indonesian dish that consists of tender pieces of chicken simmered in a sweet and spicy sauce. Here is a recipe for Opor Ayam:

Ingredients: 3 fillet steaks, 200g porter, 1/2 kg yukhoe sauce, 1/4 kg beef suet, 250ml soy sauce, 50g garlic, 2-3 sprigs of chives, 1 spring of green onion, 1 small piece of ginger, 1-2 tbsp sesame oil

Walt Disney began his career as a commercial artist and animator in Kansas City and Los Angeles before moving to Hollywood in 1923. He co-founded the Disney Brothers Cartoon Studio with his brother Roy O. Disney in 1923, and later established The Walt Disney Company with Roy in 1923.

Disney is best known as the creator of Walt Disney Animation Studios, which became one of the most successful and well-known animation studios in the world. His work as an animator and producer included the creation of classic films such as Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937), Pinocchio (1940), Fantasia (1940), Dumbo (1941), Bambi (1942), Cinderella (1950), Alice in Wonderland (1951), Peter Pan (1953), Lady and the Tramp (1955), Sleeping Beauty (1959), and The Jungle Book (1967).

In addition to his work in animation, Disney was also involved in the development of theme parks, including Disneyland, which opened in Anaheim, California in 1955. He also produced live-action films through his company Walt Disney Productions.

Disney died on December 15, 1966, at age 65. His legacy continues today through The Walt Disney Company, which produces films, television shows, theme parks, and other entertainment products that bear his name.
